contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = Tropiduridae | image = Mperuvianus.jpg | image_caption = ''Microlophus peruvianus'' | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[Reptile|Reptilia]] | ordo = [[Squamata]] | subordo = [[Lacertilia]] | familia = '''Tropiduridae''' | subdivision_ranks = Genera | subdivision = 7 recognized genera, See article. }} The '''Tropiduridae''' are a family of [[iguanid]] lizards native to [[South America]] and the [[West Indies]]. Commonly known as '''[[Neotropical]] ground lizards''', most are ground-dwelling animals, and the family includes some lizards adapted to relatively cold climates, including those of the [[Andes]] mountains and [[Tierra del Fuego]]. Several species give birth to [[viviparous|live young]].<ref name=EoR>{{cite book |editor=Cogger, H.G. & Zweifel, R.G.|author= Bauer, Aaron M.|year=1998|title=Encyclopedia of Reptiles and Amphibians|publisher= Academic Press|location=San Diego|pages= 145|isbn= 0-12-178560-2}}</ref> The [[genera]] are: * ''[[Microlophus]]'' – lava lizards and Pacific iguanas (sometimes in ''Tropidurus'') * ''[[Plesiomicrolophus]]'' * ''[[Plica (genus)|Plica]]'' * ''[[Stenocercus]]'' – whorltail iguanas * ''[[Tropidurus]]'' (including ''Platynotus, Strobilurus, Tapinurus'') * ''[[Uracentron]]'' – thornytail iguanas (sometimes in ''Tropidurus'') * ''[[Uranoscodon]]'' ==References== {{wikispecies-inline|Tropiduridae}} {{Reflist}}<!--added above categories/infobox footers by script-assisted edit--> ==External links== * [http://www.jcvi.org/reptiles/families/tropiduridae.php Tropiduridae] [[Category:Lizards]] [[Category:Tropidurids]]
